clinical_study.brief_title: Cohort/Ethics Study of Patients With Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis Undergoing Early Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Cohort/Ethics Study of Patients With Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis Undergoing Early Liver Transplantation

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop a clinical understanding of early liver transplantation (ELT) for patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis (SAH) and identify the public's opinion regarding this practice.

detailed_description.textblock:
The research study is designed to improve the investigators' understanding of early liver transplantation for patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis. The goal of this research is twofold:
1. Establish a knowledge base necessary for appropriate liver transplant candidate selection by quantifying post-ELT mortality for SAH and compare to outcomes to liver transplantation for other indications
2. Develop an ethical framework for implementation of these transplants for SAH based on the opinions of healthcare providers and the general public.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who survived within 1 year post-transplant
primary_outcome.description: Post-transplant survival within one year of the surgical procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who self-report or have biochemically measured alcohol recidivism or relapse within 1 year post-transplant
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported or biochemically measured alcohol recidivism or relapse.

arm_group.description: Early Liver Transplantation (ELT) for patients who presented with Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis (SAH)
Early Liver Transplantation (ELT) for patients who present with Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis (SAH)
Orthotopic Liver Transplantation (OLT) in patient who present with Alcoholic Liver Disease (ALD)

study_pop.textblock: Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis patients listed for liver transplatation at Johns Hopkins Hospital and patients undergoing liver transplantation at Johns Hopkins Hospital for Alcoholic Liver Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis patients:
- Patients with Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis (SAH) listed for liver transplantation at Johns Hopkins Hospital (JHH), have not been sober for at least 6 months at time of waitlisting, and are at least 18 years old.
Exclusion Criteria for Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis patients:
- Non-SAH patients listed for liver transplantation at JHH and patients who have been sober for at least 6 months at the time of waitlisting.
Inclusion Criteria for non-SAH comparison group:
- Patients 18 years or older undergoing liver transplantation at JHH for alcoholic liver disease and were sober for at least 6 months prior to transplantation.
Exclusion Criteria for non-SAH comparison group:
- Patients who do not meet inclusion criteria.
